header.description: The Micro Focus Fortify Static Code Analyzer plugin allows you to execute static code analysis testing as part of a workflow.

step-type.name: Update Fortify Rulepacks
step-type.description: Update Fortify Security Content (Rulepacks) prior to a scan.

property-ui.label: Update Server URL
property-ui.description: Update server URL from where rulepacks should be downloaded.

property-ui.label: Update Options
property-ui.description: A list of new-line separated options to add to the Update command.

property-ui.label: Fortify Executable Path
property-ui.description: Full path to the Fortify executables on the Agent, leave empty if already on system path.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Fortify SCA Clean
step-type.description: Clean up from a previous scan.

property-ui.label: Build ID
property-ui.description: Unique identifier for the scan.

property-ui.label: Maximum heap memory (MB)
property-ui.description: The maximum heap size for the JVM (-Xmx). This must be an integer value representing the amount of MB to allocate to the JVM heap.

property-ui.label: Additional JVM Options
property-ui.description: Additional options to send to the JVM.

property-ui.label: Additional Options
property-ui.description: A new-line separated list of additional options to pass to the Fortify command.

property-ui.label: Fortify Executable Path
property-ui.description: Full path to the Fortify executables on the Agent, leave empty if already on system path.

property-ui.label: Delete Log
property-ui.description: Select this option to delete a previously created scan log.

property-ui.label: Log Filename
property-ui.description: The name of the log file to create/append to during execution.

property-ui.label: Verbose Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display verbose output during execution.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Fortify SCA Translate
step-type.description: Convert source code to intermediary files to use in a scan.

property-ui.label: Build ID
property-ui.description: Unique identifier for the scan.

property-ui.label: Maximum heap memory (MB)
property-ui.description: The maximum heap size for the JVM (-Xmx). This must be an integer value representing the amount of MB to allocate to the JVM heap.

property-ui.label: Additional JVM Options
property-ui.description: Additional options to send to the JVM.

property-ui.label: Includes List
property-ui.description: List of files/directories to include in the scan. Wildcards (** and *) are allowed (e.g. ./**/*.java). Start each file or path with a new line.

property-ui.label: Excludes List
property-ui.description: List of files/directories to exclude from the scan. Wildcards (** and *) are allowed (e.g. ./**/*.java). Start each file or path with a new line.

property-ui.label: Additional Options
property-ui.description: A new-line separated list of additional options to pass to the Fortify command.

property-ui.label: Fortify Executable Path
property-ui.description: Full path to the Fortify executables on the Agent, leave empty if already on system path.

property-ui.label: Log File
property-ui.description: The name of the log file to create/append to during execution.

property-ui.label: Verbose Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display verbose output during execution.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Fortify SCA Scan
step-type.description: Run a scan with Fortify Source Analyzer.

property-ui.label: Build ID
property-ui.description: Unique identifier for the scan.

property-ui.label: Maximum heap memory (MB)
property-ui.description: The maximum heap size for the JVM (-Xmx). This must be an integer value representing the amount of MB to allocate to the JVM heap.

property-ui.label: Additional JVM Options
property-ui.description: Additional options to send to the JVM.

property-ui.label: Scan Options
property-ui.description: A list of new-line separated file-specifier scan options to add to the Fortify Scan command. e.g. 'src/**/*.java'

property-ui.label: Results File
property-ui.description: The name of the results file to create, if left empty it will be set to 'da_fortify_scan.fpr'.

property-ui.label: Additional Options
property-ui.description: A new-line separated list of additional options to pass to the Fortify command.

property-ui.label: Fortify Executable Path
property-ui.description: Full path to the Fortify executables on the Agent, leave empty if already on system path.

property-ui.label: Log File
property-ui.description: The name of the log file to create/append to during execution.

property-ui.label: Quick Scan
property-ui.description: Select this option to perform a quick scan.

property-ui.label: Verbose Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display verbose output during execution.

property-ui.label: Debug Output
property-ui.description: Select this option to display debug output during execution.

step-type.name: Fortify SSC Upload
step-type.description: Upload the results of a scan to Software Security Center.

property-ui.label: Results File
property-ui.description: The name of the results file to upload.

property-ui.label: SSC Application Name
property-ui.description: The name of the related application in Software Security Center.

property-ui.label: SSC Version Name
property-ui.description: The name of the related application version in Software Security Center.

property-ui.label: SSC Server URL
property-ui.description: The Software Security Center server URL, e.g. https://server:8080/ssc

property-ui.label: SSC Server Authentication Token
property-ui.description: An AnalysisUploadToken authentication token to connect to Software Security Center.

property-ui.label: Credentials File
property-ui.description: Relative path to a credentials file containing 'user' and 'password' or 'authtoken' values
